subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Inanna: The First Great Goddess
description: A 60-second lesson on Inanna: The First Great Goddess.

hook.text: She descended to the underworld, died, and was reborn. Inanna's story predates Jesus by 3,000 years. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: Inanna was Sumer's goddess of love, war, and power. Her descent myth is one of the oldest stories ever written.

discovery.text: At each gate of the underworld, she surrendered clothing and power. She arrived naked and was killed by her sister.

twist.text: She was resurrected after three days. Death and resurrection themes began here, millennia before Christianity.

climax.text: Inanna proves that the resurrection narrative is humanity's oldest hope. We have always dreamed of defeating death.

punchline.text: Death and rebirth in three days. Inanna told that story 5,000 years ago.

quiz.question: Why is the Inanna myth significant?
options: It's one of the oldest death-and-resurrection narratives ever written
